Python Backend Developer.text: Tell me about yourself and your backend engineering experience.
Python Backend Developer.model_answer: I have experience building scalable APIs with Django/Flask and optimizing SQL queries.

Python Backend Developer.text: What is the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL)?
Python Backend Developer.model_answer: A mutex that allows only one thread to control the Python interpreter, limiting CPU-bound concurrency.
Lists are mutable (changeable) using brackets; tuples are immutable using parentheses.
Functions that modify the behavior of other functions, often used for logging or auth.

Python Backend Developer.text: How is memory managed in Python?
Python Backend Developer.model_answer: Via a private heap and automatic garbage collection using reference counting.
'==' checks value equality; 'is' checks reference identity (memory address).
It turns a function into a generator, returning values one by one lazily.
A concise syntax for creating lists from existing iterables.
Shallow copies references; deep copy creates independent duplicates of objects.
Files containing Python code (functions/classes) that can be imported.
It represents the instance of the class and accesses its attributes/methods.
An anonymous inline function defined with the lambda keyword.
In Python 2, range returns a list, xrange returns a generator. In Python 3, range is a generator.
The process of serializing a Python object structure into a byte stream.
The constructor method initialized when an object is created.
Objects that can be iterated upon (implementing __iter__ and __next__).
Using try, except, finally blocks to manage runtime errors.
The style guide for Python code to ensure readability.
Threading shares memory (limited by GIL); Processing uses separate memory spaces.
Objects that customize attribute access (get/set/delete) in classes.

Data Scientist.text: Tell me about your background in Data Science.
Data Scientist.model_answer: I specialize in building predictive models using Python and SQL.
Bias is error from simple assumptions (underfitting); Variance is error from complexity (overfitting).
When a model learns noise in training data and fails to generalize.
Probability of observing results assuming the null hypothesis is true (<0.05 is significant).
Supervised uses labeled data (regression); Unsupervised uses unlabeled data (clustering).
A table showing TP, TN, FP, FN to evaluate classification performance.
An ensemble method using multiple decision trees to improve accuracy.
L1 (Lasso) performs feature selection; L2 (Ridge) shrinks weights evenly.
Partitioning data into subsets to train and test the model multiple times.
Optimization algorithm to minimize cost function by updating parameters iteratively.
Plot of True Positive Rate vs False Positive Rate at various thresholds.
Imputation (mean/median), dropping rows, or using robust algorithms.
Normalization scales to [0,1]; Standardization scales to mean 0, std 1.
Principal Component Analysis reduces dimensionality while preserving variance.
Partitioning data into K clusters by minimizing variance within clusters.
Comparing two versions to see which performs better statistically.
Probabilistic classifier based on Bayes' theorem assuming feature independence.
Data points collected or recorded at specific time intervals.
ML subset using neural networks with many layers to learn patterns.
Standard language for managing and querying relational databases.

Full Stack Developer (MERN).text: Describe your full stack development experience.
Full Stack Developer (MERN).model_answer: I build scalable web apps using React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.
Lightweight copy of DOM; React uses it to minimize direct DOM manipulation.
SQL is relational/structured; NoSQL is document/key-value based and scalable.
Functions like useState/useEffect to use state in functional components.
Passing data through multiple layers; solve with Context or Redux.
Architectural style using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST) for services.
Functions executing during request-response cycle to modify request objects.
Security feature restricting requests from different origins.
JSON Web Token; used for secure, stateless authentication.
Var is function-scoped; Let/Const are block-scoped. Const is immutable.
Object representing eventual completion of an async operation.
Server-Side Rendering sends HTML; Client-Side renders in browser.
State management library for JavaScript apps using a central store.
Mechanism allowing Node.js to perform non-blocking I/O operations.
Using HTML tags that convey meaning (article, nav) for accessibility.
Layout logic: Content, Padding, Border, Margin.
A NoSQL database storing data in JSON-like documents.
Syntactic sugar for Promises making async code look synchronous.
A module bundler for JavaScript applications.
Structuring apps as collection of small, independent services.

DevOps Engineer.text: Tell me about your DevOps skillset.
DevOps Engineer.model_answer: I manage CI/CD pipelines, containerization with Docker, and cloud infra.
Continuous Integration/Deployment; automating testing and releasing code.
Docker shares OS kernel (light); VMs have full OS (heavy).
Orchestration tool for managing containerized applications at scale.
Managing infra via config files (Terraform) instead of manual setup.
Distributes traffic across servers to ensure availability.
Creating separate lines of development (feature branches) to isolate code.
Automation server used to build and deploy CI/CD pipelines.
Running two envs (Blue/Green); switching traffic to new version instantly.
Monitoring tool for recording real-time metrics in time series DB.
Ansible is configuration management; Terraform is infrastructure provisioning.
Server retrieving resources on behalf of client (e.g., Nginx).
Command used to search text using patterns.
Secure Shell; protocol for secure remote login.
The smallest deployable unit containing one or more containers.
Tool for monitoring systems, networks, and infrastructure.
Creating virtual version of resource (server/storage) via hypervisor.
Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana; used for log analysis.
Executing automated tests as part of the delivery pipeline.
Command to run programs with security privileges of another user (root).

Java Backend Developer.text: Tell me about your Java development experience.
Java Backend Developer.model_answer: I build enterprise applications using Spring Boot and Hibernate.
Java Virtual Machine; engine that runs Java bytecode.
Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction.
ArrayList uses dynamic array (fast lookup); LinkedList uses nodes (fast insert).
Framework for building stand-alone, production-grade Spring apps easily.
Design pattern where objects receive their dependencies from framework.
Checked are compile-time (IOException); Unchecked are runtime (NullPointer).
ORM framework mapping Java classes to database tables.
Build automation tool used for dependency management.
Interface has only abstract methods (pre-Java 8); Abstract class can have implementation.
Key-value collection allowing nulls and not preserving order.
Belongs to the class rather than instance; shared by all objects.
Automatic memory management freeing unused objects.
Web services following REST architecture constraints.
Concurrent execution of two or more parts of a program.
String is immutable; StringBuilder is mutable and faster for concat.
Java Database Connectivity API for connecting to databases.
Converting an object state to byte stream.
Prevents modification (variable), inheritance (class), or overriding (method).
Ensures a class has only one instance and provides global access.

Cybersecurity Analyst.text: Tell me about your cybersecurity background.
Cybersecurity Analyst.model_answer: I monitor networks for vulnerabilities and perform penetration testing.
Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability; core principles of security.
Malicious SQL code inserted into inputs to manipulate database.
Symmetric uses one key; Asymmetric uses public/private key pair.
Cross-Site Scripting; injecting scripts into trusted websites.
Fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive info by disguising as trustworthy.
Network security system monitoring/blocking traffic based on rules.
Distributed Denial of Service; flooding a server to disrupt service.
Multi-Factor Authentication; using 2+ verifications for access.
VPN encrypts all traffic; Proxy only hides IP for specific requests.
Malware encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption.
One-way conversion of data into a fixed-size string (digest).
Attack targeting a vulnerability unknown to the vendor.
Attacker secretly intercepts/alters communication between two parties.
Simulated cyberattack to identify vulnerabilities.
Protocols for establishing encrypted links between server and browser.
Manipulating people into divulging confidential info.
IDS detects attacks; IPS detects and prevents them.
Network of infected devices controlled by an attacker.
Adding random data to passwords before hashing to prevent rainbow table attacks.

Cloud Architect (AWS).model_answer: I design scalable, fault-tolerant systems using AWS core services.
EC2 is virtual servers (IaaS); Lambda is serverless compute (FaaS).
Simple Storage Service; object storage for data.
Virtual Private Cloud; isolated network section in AWS.
Identity and Access Management; controls access to AWS resources.
Horizontal adds more instances; Vertical adds power (CPU/RAM) to existing instance.
Service to model and provision AWS resources via code.
Scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service.
Relational Database Service; managed SQL databases.
Automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady performance.
Content Delivery Network (CDN) delivering data via edge locations.
Standard is for frequent access; Glacier is for long-term archiving.
Elastic Load Balancer; distributes incoming application traffic.
Systems durable and likely to operate continuously without failure.
Elastic Block Store; block storage volumes for EC2.
AWS secures the cloud; Customer secures data IN the cloud.
Simple Notification Service; pub/sub messaging.
Managed NoSQL database service.
Isolated data centers within a Region.
Monitoring and observability service.

Frontend Engineer.text: Tell me about your frontend skills.
Frontend Engineer.model_answer: I build responsive UIs using HTML5, CSS3, and Modern JavaScript.
Document Object Model; representation of HTML structure.
Layout model for distributing space along a single dimension.
2-dimensional layout system for rows and columns.
Local persists after window close; Session expires when tab closes.
Function remembering its lexical scope even when executed outside it.
Event starts at target element and propagates up to ancestors.
Asynchronous JavaScript and XML; updating page without reload.
Designing sites to adapt to different screen sizes.
Refers to the object executing the current function.
Instruction telling browser what version of HTML to use.
Keywords like :hover used to define state of an element.
Moving declarations to top of scope during compilation.
JavaScript Object Notation; format for data interchange.
Attributes to make web content accessible to disabled users.
GET requests data (url visible); POST submits data (secure body).
Network of servers delivering content based on user location.
Limiting rate at which a function fires.
Binary instruction format for running high-performance code in browser.
CSS property controlling vertical stacking order of elements.
